variants.HGVS: N.D. (HGVS nomenclature not provided in the literature, unable to standardize without further information)

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant proteins and synthetic phospholipid vesicles
Material used.Material Name: Brain PE/brain PS (1:1, w/w) MLVs, wild - type a - Syn, A30P a - Syn, A53T a - Syn, A53T/A30P a - Syn
Material used.Description: Brain PE/brain PS (1:1, w/w) MLVs were mixed with either WT or A30P a - Syn at 10:1 and 20:1 mass ratios (188:1 and 376:1 molar ratios) of phospholipid to protein and incubated in PBS at 25 °C for one hour. For A53T and A53T/A30P, similar lipid - protein ratio mixtures were used in related binding studies.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (protein amount in pellet and supernatant)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (significantly impaired binding compared to WT)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (defective in binding to phospholipid vesicles)
Readout description.Result Description: Barely detectable levels of A30P a - Syn were found in the membrane pellet. Doubling the concentration of MLVs as compared to a - Syn did not change the amount of A30P in the pellet. Unbound A30P a - Syn in the supernatant was higher compared to WT.

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (comparable to WT in terms of membrane - binding activity)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: No Effect (in terms of membrane - binding activity)
Readout description.Result Description: A53T a - Syn displayed a normal membrane - binding activity that was comparable to wild - type a - Syn.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (defective in membrane binding similar to A30P)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (defective in binding to phospholipid vesicles)
Readout description.Result Description: The double mutant A53T/A30P a - Syn showed defective membrane binding similar to the A30P protein.

Biological replicates.Description: These experiments were repeated several times to confirm their reproducibility.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal would be similar binding as wild - type a - Syn to lipid vesicles)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal would be significantly reduced binding compared to wild - type a - Syn to lipid vesicles)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Vesicle ultracentrifugation is a common method to study protein - lipid binding, which is relevant to Parkinson's disease research as it helps understand the membrane - binding properties of a - Syn mutants related to the disease)

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant proteins and synthetic phospholipid vesicles
Material used.Material Name: POPC/bPS, bPE/bPS, POPC/POPA vesicles, wild - type a - Syn, A30P a - Syn, A53T a - Syn, A53T/A30P a - Syn
Material used.Description: a - Synuclein (0.1 - 0.2 mg/ml; 6.9 - 13.8 mM) was incorporated into MLVs (lipid concentration of 1 - 2 mg/ml; 1.3 - 2.6 mM) of various phospholipids. Samples were incubated and then used for CD measurements.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (ellipticity at 222 nm as a measure of a - helicity)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (failed to undergo typical structural transition from random coil to a - helix like WT)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (defective in binding to phospholipid vesicles)
Readout description.Result Description: CD spectra of A30P and A53T/A30P a - Syn in the presence of POPC/bPS vesicles were virtually identical with a - Syn in buffer alone. The extent of PE - induced a - helicity was much less for A30P and A53T/A30P a - Syn compared to WT or A53T a - Syn.

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (underwent conformational transition from random coil to a - helix similar to WT)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: No Effect (in terms of membrane - binding - induced conformational change)
Readout description.Result Description: WT and A53T a - Syn bound to POPC/bPS vesicles and underwent a conformational transition from random coil to a - helical secondary structure, as shown by increased ellipticities.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (failed to undergo typical structural transition from random coil to a - helix like WT)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (defective in binding to phospholipid vesicles)
Readout description.Result Description: CD spectra of A30P and A53T/A30P a - Syn in the presence of POPC/bPS vesicles were virtually identical with a - Syn in buffer alone. The extent of PE - induced a - helicity was much less for A30P and A53T/A30P a - Syn compared to WT or A53T a - Syn.

Biological replicates.Description: CD values at 222 nm from three to four separate experiments were averaged and standard deviations were indicated.

Technical replicates.Description: Three scans per sample were averaged.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal would be similar ellipticity changes as wild - type a - Syn indicating similar conformational transition)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal would be significantly different ellipticity changes compared to wild - type a - Syn indicating disrupted conformational transition)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Circular dichroism spectroscopy is a common method to study protein secondary structure changes, which is relevant to Parkinson's disease research as it helps understand the structural changes of a - Syn mutants related to the disease)

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant proteins and synthetic phospholipid vesicles
Material used.Material Name: bPE/POPS MLVs, wild - type a - Syn, A30P a - Syn
Material used.Description: Equimolar mixtures of bPE and POPS were dried, dispersed in buffer or a - Syn solution, vortexed, ultracentrifuged, and then dialyzed against PEG solutions. Samples were mounted for X - ray diffraction.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (did not significantly alter the pressure - versus - repeat distance relationship of the pure lipid bilayer like WT)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (defective in binding to the lipid bilayers)
Readout description.Result Description: At low osmotic pressure (8 - 10 % PEG), A30P a - Syn did not significantly change the repeat spacing, probably due to defective binding to the lipids. With 8 % PEG, the repeat distance in the presence of A30P a - Syn (135 Å) was very close to that in the absence of a - Syn (132 Å). With 10 % PEG, the repeat distance was 117 Å, which is smaller than that in the presence of WT a - Syn (127 Å).

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (significantly altered the pressure - versus - repeat distance relationship of the pure lipid bilayer)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Normal (able to interact with lipid bilayers as expected)
Readout description.Result Description: With 8 % PEG, the X - ray pattern showed disordering of the bilayer. With 10 % PEG, the repeat spacing was 127 Å, which is significantly larger than the pure lipid (104 Å).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal would be similar repeat spacing changes as wild - type a - Syn in the presence of lipid bilayers)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal would be significantly different repeat spacing changes compared to wild - type a - Syn in the presence of lipid bilayers)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Low - angle X - ray diffraction is a common method to study the structure of lipid bilayers and protein - lipid interactions, which is relevant to Parkinson's disease research as it helps understand the membrane - binding properties of a - Syn mutants related to the disease)
